factoid: Prince Andrew addressed Pierre as "my dear fellow".
Prince Andrew felt depressed and constrained with his visitor.
Prince Andrew was bivouacking here.
Prince Andrew had just come to look round the place.
Prince Andrew was going back to his sister today.
Prince Andrew would introduce Pierre to his sister.
Prince Andrew knew Pierre already.
Prince Andrew and Pierre would go after dinner.
Prince Andrew asked Pierre if he would like to look round Prince Andrew's place.
Prince Andrew and Pierre walked about until dinnertime.
Prince Andrew and Pierre talked about political news.
Prince Andrew and Pierre talked about common acquaintances.
Prince Andrew spoke with animation about the new homestead he was constructing.
Prince Andrew spoke with interest about the buildings of the new homestead.
Prince Andrew interrupted himself and said the new homestead was not interesting.
Prince Andrew suggested they have dinner and then set off.
At dinner, conversation turned to Pierre's marriage.
Prince Andrew was very much surprised when he heard of Pierre's marriage.
Pierre blushed when his marriage was mentioned.
Pierre said he would tell Prince Andrew how it all happened.
Pierre said his marriage is all over and forever.
Prince Andrew asked Pierre if Pierre knew how it all ended.
Prince Andrew asked Pierre if Pierre heard of the duel.
Pierre said he had to go through the duel.
Pierre thanked God for not killing that man.
Prince Andrew asked why Pierre thanked God for not killing that man.
Pierre said killing a vicious dog is a very good thing.
Pierre said killing a man is bad and wrong.
Prince Andrew asked why killing a man is wrong.
Pierre said it is not given to man to know what is right and what is wrong.
Pierre said men always err.
Pierre said harming another is wrong.
Pierre asked who told Pierre what is bad for another man.
Pierre said bad.
Pierre said we all know what is bad for ourselves.
Prince Andrew said the harm he is conscious of in himself is something he cannot inflict on others.
Prince Andrew spoke in French.
Prince Andrew said he only knows two very real evils in life: remorse and illness.
Prince Andrew said the only good is the absence of those evils.
Prince Andrew said living for himself avoiding remorse and illness is his philosophy.
Pierre asked about love of one's neighbor and self-sacrifice.
Prince Andrew said he cannot agree with Pierre about living only to avoid evil.
Prince Andrew said living only to avoid evil and not to repent is not enough.
Prince Andrew said he lived for himself and ruined his life.
Prince Andrew said only now when he is living for others he has understood happiness.
Prince Andrew said when Pierre sees Princess Mary, Pierre will get on with her.
Prince Andrew said everyone lives in his own way.
Prince Andrew said Pierre lived for himself and nearly ruined his life.
Prince Andrew said Pierre found happiness when living for others.
Prince Andrew said he experienced the reverse: he lived for glory.
Prince Andrew said glory is the same love of others, desire to do something for them, desire for their approval.
Prince Andrew said he lived for others, ruined his life, and became calmer since living only for himself.
Pierre asked what living only for yourself means.
Pierre asked about Prince Andrew's son, sister, and father.
Prince Andrew said his son, sister, and father are the same as himself, not others.
Prince Andrew said others are neighbors, le prochain, as Pierre and Princess Mary call it.
Prince Andrew said others are the chief source of all error and evil.
Prince Andrew said le prochain are Kiev peasants whom Pierre wants to do good for.
